units.title: Quantify input cells via impedance
units.text: To determine the overall cell capture efficiency of DisCo, we quantified the number of input cells using impedance measurements, which enabled accurate counting of the number of input cells as validated by microscopy (Extended Data Fig. 2f).
units.rationale: Describes the measurement method for input cell count.

units.title: Perform species mixing experiment
units.text: We performed a species mixing experiment of human embryonic kidney (HEK) 293T and murine immortalized brown pre-adipocyte (IBA) cells.
units.rationale: Specifies a concrete experimental setup for validation.

units.title: Benchmark cell capture and co‑encapsulation purity
units.text: As a first benchmarking experiment, we set out to determine the cell capture efficiency and the bead and cell co‑encapsulation purity of DisCo.
units.rationale: Outlines the initial performance assessment procedure.

units.title: Process low‑input cell numbers
units.text: We processed cell numbers of between 50 and 200 cells, of which 74.9% (s.d. ±10.7%) of input cells had more than 500 unique molecular identifiers (UMIs) per cell (Fig. 1j).
units.rationale: Details the range of cell inputs tested and the outcome metric.

units.title: Identify and merge closely related barcodes
units.text: We used DisCo to uncover sets on HEK 293T cells by exploiting the uniquely low number of beads in DisCo samples (<500), which enabled us to identify and merge closely related barcodes (described in Methods) without compromising single cell purity.
units.rationale: Explains a data‑processing step specific to low‑bead samples.

units.title: Assess time‑dependent effects on data quality
units.text: We assessed time‑dependent effects on the quality of the single cell data by analyzing HEK 293T cells that were loaded on our system (at 22 °C (room temperature)) for 0–20, 20–40 and 40–60 min.
units.rationale: Provides a protocol for testing storage time impact.

units.title: Store cells on ice for defined intervals
units.text: We sampled cells that were stored for 120 and 180 min on ice.
units.rationale: Specifies a controlled storage condition for downstream analysis.

units.title: Measure cell stress metrics
units.text: We measured cell stress metrics such as mitochondrial read content and heat shock protein expression.
units.rationale: Lists the biomarkers used to evaluate cell health.

units.title: Generate monodisperse emulsions with high purity
units.text: With all components operating in tight orchestration, we were able to generate monodisperse emulsions with high purity (Fig. 1e and Supplementary Video 2).
units.rationale: Describes the droplet formation step essential for downstream sequencing.

units.title: Control fluid flow via microvalves
units.text: Implementation of Quake‑style microvalves to facilitate flow control during operation; the development of a machine‑vision‑based approach utilizing subsequent image subtraction for blob detection to move particles into the target region of interest with 95.9% of particles placed in the ~200‑μm‑wide region.
units.rationale: Details the hardware‑driven fluidic control that enables deterministic co‑encapsulation.
